study.study_title: Yost et al., Clonal replacement of tumor-specific T cells following PD-1 blockade
study.study_description: Paired single-cell RNA and T cell receptor sequencing on 79,046 cells from site-matched tumors from patients with basal or squamous cell carcinoma before and after anti-PD-1 therapy.
study.inclusion_exclusion_criteria: include: advanced or metastatic BCC or SCC not suitable for surgical resection; exclude: previous exposure to checkpoint blockade agents and systemic immunosuppressant use, treatment with radiotherapy or other anti-cancer agents within 4 weeks of first biopsy
study.grants: This work was supported by the Parker Institute for Cancer Immunotherapy (A.T.S., D.K.W., R.K., S.L.B., M.M.D. and H.Y.C.), the Michelson Foundation (A.T.S.) and the National Institutes of Health (NIH) (P50HG007735, R35CA209919 (H.Y.C.), K08CA230188 (A.T.S.), K23CA211793 (K.Y.S.), R01CA182514, DP1-CA238296 (C.C.) and 5U19AI057229 (M.M.D.)). K.E.Y. was supported by the National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellowship Program (NSF DGE-1656518) and a Stanford Graduate Fellowship. A.T.S. was supported by a Bridge Scholar Award from the Parker Institute for Cancer Immunotherapy, a Career Award for Medical Scientists  from the Burroughs Wellcome Fund and the Human Vaccines Project Michelson Prize for Human Immunology and Vaccine Research.
study.lab_name: Chang Lab, Center for Personal Dynamic Regulomes, Stanford University School of Medicine

The cell suspension was then passed through a 70-ÃÂ¾ÃÂ¼m filter and pelleted by centrifugation at 300g at 4 ÃÂ²ÃÂ°C for 10 min. Cells were then resuspended in 1 ml of RPMI 1640 medium and cryopreserved in fetal bovine serum supplemented with 10% dimethylsulfoxide until further processing.
sample.cell_quality: Propidium iodine (P3566, Invitrogen) was used for live/dead staining at a final concentration of 2.5 ÃÂ¾ÃÂ¼g/ml
sample.cell_isolation: Cells were categorized as peri-tumoral T cells (CD45+CD3+), other peri-tumoral lymphocytes (CD45+CD3ÃÂÃÂÃ¢ÂÂ) and malignant/stromal cells (CD45ÃÂÃÂÃ¢ÂÂCD3ÃÂÃÂÃ¢ÂÂ). For patients su009, su010, su011, su012, su013 and su014, only peri-tumoral T cells were isolated and used for scRNA-seq. For sample su010-S, we additionally isolated CD8+CD39+ peri-tumoral T cells (CD45+CD3+CD8+CD39+).
sample.library_generation_protocol: The scRNA-seq and scTCR-seq libraries were prepared using the 10x Single Cell Immune Profiling Solution Kit, according to the manufacturerÃÂÃ¢ÂÂ¬Ã¢ÂÂ¢s instructions. In brief, FACS-sorted cells were washed once with PBS containing 0.04% bovine serum albumin (BSA) and resuspended in PBS containing 0.04% BSA to a final concentration of 100ÃÂÃ¢ÂÂ¬Ã¢ÂÂ800 cells per ÃÂ¾ÃÂ¼l as determined by hemacytometer. For TCR library construction, TCR transcripts were enriched from 2 ÃÂ¾ÃÂ¼l of amplified cDNA by PCR (primer sets 1 and 2: 98 ÃÂ²ÃÂ°C for 45 s; 10 cycles of 98 ÃÂ²ÃÂ°C for 20 s, 67 ÃÂ²ÃÂ°C for 30 s, 72 ÃÂ²ÃÂ°C for 1 min; 72 ÃÂ²ÃÂ°C for 1 min). Following TCR enrichment, 5ÃÂÃ¢ÂÂ¬Ã¢ÂÂ50 ng of enriched PCR product was fragmented and end-repaired, size-selected with SPRIselect beads, PCR-amplified with sample-indexing primers (98 ÃÂ²ÃÂ°C for 45 s; 9 cycles of 98 ÃÂ²ÃÂ°C for 20 s, 54 ÃÂ²ÃÂ°C for 30 s, 72 ÃÂ²ÃÂ°C for 20 s; 72 ÃÂ²ÃÂ°C for 1 min), and sizeselected with SPRIselect beads.
